result.execSummary:
All charges against William E. Quam in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William E. Quam is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:28 AM Defendant William E. Quam in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for William E. Quam.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Jarid Steven Rankila, sworn and testifies.
Police officer City of Superior WI, on duty 4/17/22
Met with victim 1 who reported some domestic incidents with her husband
Witness identifies defendant
Attorney no response
Court questions witness on identification
Witness indicates verbal identification and recognition from prior LE contacts. Describes what he's wearing and where he's seated.
Court record reflects identification of defendant.
Douglas County WI 4/11/22 incident

Attorney Anderson cross examines witness

State final comments
Defense final comments

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

no contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in the ID Key but may go to property once with law enforcement to retrieve belongings, defendant must update address within 24 hours of release.

1:31 PM Defendant William E. Quam appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Hoffman makes special appearance.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State makes requests on Bail: $500 signature bond and no contact with victim 1 and give keys to the vehicle. Atty Hoffman has no objections to the $500 signature bond and no contact with victim 1. Atty Hoffman questions defendant regarding the keys
Court Orders $1500 signature bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in the ID Key, defendant must update address within 24 hours of release. Court will not address exchanges of personal property. Defendant does qualify for Public Defender
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
